description: System-generated unique identifier for the saved query/report definition.
User-facing name of the saved query or report.
Short description of the query/reportâ€™s purpose to help users select it.
Primary database table or view the query/report draws data from.
Functional category used to organize the query within the application.
JRXML layout template content used to render the report output.
Custom SQL statement that defines the data selection and aggregation for this query.
User designated as the owner or maintainer of the query.
Height of the report title band in the output layout.
Height of the column header band in the report layout.
Height of each detail row band in the report layout.
Height allocated to subtotal or group footer sections.
Height allocated to the final totals or summary section.
User who originally created the query configuration.
Timestamp when the query configuration was created.
User who last modified the query configuration.
Timestamp of the most recent update to the query configuration.
Indicates whether this is a customer-defined query versus a delivered system template.
User who last executed the query/report.
Timestamp when the query/report was last executed.
Text displayed in the report header, such as a title or tagline.
Text displayed in the report footer, such as company name or disclaimers.
Serialized list of chart configurations included in the report output.
Name of the work group associated with access or ownership; likely security-related; confirm with SME.
Additional filter logic or expressions beyond basic conditions; likely serialized; confirm with SME.
Flag indicating page orientation; 1 = portrait, 0 = landscape (or similar).
Controls cascading behavior of parameter prompts or style inheritance; likely an option flag; confirm with SME.
Default font size used in the report layout or printed output.
Indicates whether the query returns summary-only (aggregated) results instead of detailed rows.
Stored definition of output columns, including selection, order, labels, and widths.
Stored filter criteria and parameter values applied when running the query.
When enabled, formats each result record on a single printed line; confirm behavior with SME.
